title: Labor in box seat ahead of 2026 Victorian election — but challenges are mounting | ABC News
description: New opposition leader Jess Wilson has unveiled the team she'll take to the state election in 12 months, and while one former leader has been handed an olive branch another is still on the outer.  Brad Battin will stay in shadow cabinet, taking on the police and corrections portfolio, while John Pesutto will stay on the back bench. Jess Wilson will retain the shadow treasurer role, setting her sights on Victoria's soaring debt.  Jacinta Allan, on the other hand, is firmly focused on major projects and unwavering in her strategy for building them.  State political reporter Richard Willingham spoke to both leaders a year out from polling day. WorkSafe is investigating the incident. title: Markets prepare for "chaos and turmoil" as Japan sees dramatic bond yield movements | The Business
description: Analysts will be paying close attention to Japanese markets overnight and for the next few days after some big moves in the bond markets, which has seen interest rates rise across the curve.  Wilson Asset Management lead portfolio manager Matthew Haupt is forecasting a potential night of "chaos and turmoil" as the yen carry-trade unwinds. He says it appears as though there's been an uncontrolled sell-off in bonds.  "When this transfers through the rest of the market, a lot of the momentum and growth and risky assets get sold ... we're starting to see early signs of this happening, whether it flows through to European sessions and US sessions, that's yet to be told," he said. #ABCBusiness  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: TGA warning for Ozempic-style drugs over suicidal thoughts risk | ABC NEWS
description: The TGA has issued a safety alert concerning GLP-1 medications, including Ozempic, Wegovy, and Mounjaro, used to manage type 2 diabetes and obesity.  Patients are advised to inform their doctor about any changes in mood or behaviour while taking these medications.  Dr Terri-Lynne South from the Royal Australian College of General Practitioners says there is a complex relationship between mental health and metabolic health, where each can affect the other. title: House prices continue to climb but rates outlook removes some heat | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: Housing prices continue to climb across the country but the pace of growth is easing as the Sydney and Melbourne markets lag the mid-sized capital cities.  Perth led the monthly gains, followed by Brisbane, Adelaide, Darwin, Hobart, the regions, Canberra, Sydney and Melbourne.    Cotality's national Home Value Index rose 1 per cent in November and 7.5 per cent for the year.  The skew towards the mid-sized capitals is especially evident in Perth, where listings are holding more than 40 per cent below average.  In comparison, Sydney had a smaller shortfall in supply compared to demand, as listings are tracking just 2.2 per cent below the five-year average, compared to 16 per cent below average listings across the capital cities.  Cotality head of research Eliza Owen told The Business the slight easing in home value growth in November was not a huge surprise, given the shifting outlook for rates.  She said interest rate cuts had been keeping the market momentum alive through 2025. Now the outlook has changed, she thinks that's affecting buyer decision-making.   Another factor at play in the housing market heading into the new year will be recently announced lending limits.  The banking regulator APRA said it would restrict high debt-to-income (DTI) ratio loans to 20 per cent of a bank's new lending.  Ms Owen said it was a preventive measure that would have limited impact on prices because the majority of new mortgages are below this threshold.  #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-12-01/home-price-streak-continues-but-rates-outlook-takes-out-heat/106083314  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. description: AEMO has warned that the energy grid is unprepared for the Eraring coal plant's closure. title: Tiwi Islands man guilty of murdering international student, NT Supreme Court jury finds | ABC NEWS
description: In February 2023, Bangladeshi student Isfaqur Rahman arrived in Darwin to start a new life and begin his studies at Charles Darwin University.  Three months later, he was bashed to death by a man he didn't know while asleep in his bed.  Today a jury found Brendan Kantilla guilty of murder. And a warning - the following report contains distressing details.  Court reporter Olivana Lathouris was there and has this story for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency after floods, landslides kill hundreds | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The death toll in Sri Lanka continues to rise with more than 355 people confirmed dead after strong winds and torrential rains from Cyclone Ditwah lashed the island. A state of emergency has been declared as the country reels from one of the worst flood disasters in two decades.  Bismarck Swangin, a spokesperson for UNICEF in Sri Lanka, tells The World about the current situation on the ground. title: Why surfers will have to pay to access Fiji's world-class breaks | The World | ABC News
description: Surfers wanting to catch a wave in Fiji could soon have to pay for the privilege as the government moves to repeal a unique law that opened up access to the country's world class reef breaks for tourists and locals alike. Foreign-owned resorts used to have exclusive access rights to famous waves like Cloudbreak, off Fiji's Tavarua Island, so you had to be a paying guest to ride them. Fiji surfing pioneer Ian Ravouvou Muller told The World's Girish Sawlani h welcomes the repeal and says he is looking forward to no longer feeling like a second-class citizen in his own country. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
